Frequently Asked Questions

Everything you need to know about our garage door services

81 Questions Answered across 7 Categories

Can't find your answer? Contact us or call (201) 554-6769

Service & Availability

Hours, response times, and service areas

15 Questions

Do you offer same-day garage door repair service?

Yes! We offer same-day service for most repairs in Northern New Jersey. For emergencies, we offer 24/7 service available.

Do you provide 24/7 emergency garage door service?

Yes, we have technicians on call 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, including weekends and holidays. When you have a garage door emergency, we're here to help.

What areas do you serve in Northern New Jersey?

We proudly serve 70+ cities across Northern New Jersey, including Essex, Bergen, Hudson, Passaic, and Morris counties. Our priority service areas include Newark, Jersey City, Paterson, Elizabeth, Clifton, Hackensack, and surrounding communities. Call us to confirm we serve your ZIP code.

How promptly can you respond to an emergency call?

We respond to emergency calls as promptly as possible, typically within 1-2 hours depending on your location and current demand. Our goal is to get your garage door working safely as soon as possible.

What brands of garage doors and openers do you service?

We service all major garage door and opener brands including LiftMaster, Chamberlain, Genie, Craftsman, Clopay, Amarr, Wayne Dalton, CHI, Raynor, and more. Our technicians are trained on all makes and models.

Can you match the color of my existing garage door for panel replacement?

Yes, we work with all major manufacturers to color-match your door for panel replacement. While exact matches depend on your door's age and weathering, we provide the closest possible match and can show you samples before installation.

Do you install smart garage door openers?

Yes! We install and configure smart WiFi openers from LiftMaster MyQ, Chamberlain MyQ, and Genie Aladdin Connect. Control your garage from anywhere, receive alerts, and integrate with Alexa, Google Home, or Apple HomeKit.

Do you service commercial garage doors?

Yes, we provide commercial garage door service including installation, repair, and maintenance for businesses, warehouses, loading docks, and commercial properties throughout Northern NJ. We handle roll-up doors, sectional doors, and high-speed doors.

How long does a typical garage door repair take?

Most common repairs like spring replacement or cable repair take 1-2 hours. Opener repairs typically take 30-90 minutes. More complex repairs may take longer. We provide time estimates when scheduling your appointment.

Do you repair garage doors on weekends and holidays?

Yes! We offer full service seven days a week, including weekends and holidays. Garage door emergencies don't follow a schedule, and neither do we. Same rates apply regardless of when you need us.

Can you repair any type of garage door?

Yes, we repair all types of garage doors including sectional doors, roll-up doors, side-hinged doors, tilt-up doors, and carriage-style doors. We work with steel, wood, aluminum, fiberglass, and composite materials.

Do you offer preventive maintenance services?

Yes! We offer comprehensive preventive maintenance packages that include safety inspection, lubrication, spring adjustment, hardware tightening, and testing. Annual maintenance can extend your door's life by up to 30% and prevent unexpected breakdowns.

What should I do if my garage door is stuck?

Stop trying to force it open or closed immediately, as this can cause further damage or injury. Disconnect the opener by pulling the red release cord, and call us right away. We'll diagnose the issue and get your door working safely.

Can you install a new garage door opener on my existing door?

Yes! We can install a new opener on virtually any existing garage door, provided the door is in good working condition. We'll assess your door during our free estimate and recommend the ideal opener for your specific door type and weight.

Do you carry parts on your service trucks?

Yes, our trucks are fully stocked with the most common parts including springs, cables, rollers, hinges, and opener components. This allows us to complete most repairs on the first visit without delays.

Pricing & Payment

Costs, estimates, and payment options

12 Questions

Do you provide free estimates?

Yes! We provide free, no-obligation on-site estimates for all services. Our technicians will assess your garage door, explain the problem, provide upfront pricing, and answer all your questions before starting any work.

What payment methods do you accept?

We accept cash, all major credit cards (Visa, MasterCard, American Express, Discover), debit cards, and checks. Payment is due upon completion of service.

Do you charge extra for emergency service?

Our standard labor rates apply for emergency calls. We provide upfront pricing before starting any work, so there are no surprises. You'll know the exact cost before we begin.

Can I get a quote over the phone?

We can provide rough estimates over the phone for common repairs based on the symptoms you describe. However, for accurate pricing, we recommend a free on-site inspection where our technician can assess the specific issue and provide upfront pricing.

How much does a typical garage door spring replacement cost?

Spring replacement typically ranges from $150-$350 depending on door size, spring type, and whether it's a single or double door. We provide exact pricing during our free on-site estimate. Our 10-year warranty is included.

Do you offer financing options?

For larger projects like full door installations, we can discuss payment options. Contact us to learn more about available financing for qualified customers.

Are there any hidden fees or charges?

No. We believe in complete transparency. The price we quote is the price you pay. All costs including parts, labor, and any trip fees are discussed upfront before work begins.

Do you charge for the initial inspection?

No, we provide free on-site inspections and estimates. You only pay if you approve the work and we complete it. There's no obligation.

How much does a new garage door installation cost?

New garage door installations typically range from $800-$3,500 depending on size, material, insulation, design, and features. We offer options for every budget and provide detailed quotes with all costs itemized.

Do you offer senior or military discounts?

Yes! We offer special discounts for seniors, military personnel, and first responders as our way of saying thank you for your service. Ask about current promotions when you call.

What affects the cost of garage door repair?

Repair costs depend on the specific problem, parts needed, door type and size, and labor hours required. Common factors include spring type (torsion vs extension), door weight, number of broken parts, and whether special-order parts are needed.

Is it more cost-effective to repair or replace my garage door?

It depends on your door's age, condition, and the extent of damage. If your door is over 20 years old, has significant damage, or would cost more than 50% of a new door to repair, replacement is usually more cost-effective. We'll provide honest recommendations during our assessment.

Licensing, insurance, and certifications

12 Questions

Are you licensed and insured?

Yes, Ez2Fix LLC is fully licensed (License #13VH13553300), bonded, and insured to operate in New Jersey. All our technicians are trained, certified, and carry liability insurance for your protection.

Are your technicians certified and trained?

Yes, all our technicians are professionally trained, certified, and continuously updated on the latest garage door technologies and safety standards. We invest in ongoing education to ensure expert service.

How long have you been in business?

Ez2Fix LLC has been serving Northern New Jersey homeowners with professional garage door services. Our experienced team brings decades of combined expertise to every job.

Do you perform background checks on your technicians?

Yes, all our technicians undergo thorough background checks and drug screening before joining our team. We take your safety and security seriously.

Are you a member of any professional organizations?

Yes, we maintain memberships in professional garage door industry associations and stay current with industry standards, best practices, and safety protocols.

Do you have references or reviews I can check?

Absolutely! We have hundreds of 5-star reviews from satisfied customers. Check our Google Business profile, read testimonials on our website, or ask for local references. We're proud of our reputation.

Are you a locally owned business or a franchise?

We are a locally owned and operated business serving Northern New Jersey. We live and work in the communities we serve, and we're committed to providing our neighbors with outstanding service.

Do you subcontract work to other companies?

No, all work is performed by our own trained and certified technicians. We do not subcontract. This ensures consistent quality and accountability for every job.

What safety certifications do your technicians hold?

Our technicians are certified in garage door safety standards, including proper spring installation, safety sensor testing, and safe work practices. We follow all OSHA and industry safety guidelines.

Can I trust you in my home while I'm at work?

Absolutely. Our technicians are background-checked, uniformed, and carry ID. We treat your home with respect, protect your property, and clean up completely when finished. Many customers have us service their doors while they're away.

Do you guarantee your work?

Yes! We stand behind every job with comprehensive warranties on parts and labor. If you're not 100% satisfied, we'll make it right. Your satisfaction is our top priority.

Are you Better Business Bureau accredited?

We maintain high standards of business ethics and customer service. Check our reviews and ratings to see our commitment to customer satisfaction and professional service.

Warranties & Guarantees

Coverage and satisfaction guarantees

10 Questions

What warranty do you offer on repairs and installations?

We offer a 10-year warranty on spring replacements and new door installations, covering both parts and labor. Opener installations include manufacturer warranties (typically 1-5 years) plus our 1-year labor warranty. All repairs include a minimum 1-year warranty.

What does your warranty cover?

Our warranties cover both parts and labor. For spring replacements, we warranty the springs and installation for 10 years. If a warranted part fails under normal use, we replace it free of charge including labor.

What voids the warranty?

Warranty coverage can be voided by damage from accidents, abuse, unauthorized modifications, lack of recommended maintenance, or repairs by other companies. Normal wear and tear from proper use is covered.

Do manufacturer warranties still apply after you install parts?

Yes! Manufacturer warranties remain in effect on parts we install. Plus, you get our labor warranty on top of the manufacturer coverage. We honor all manufacturer warranties.

What if a repaired part breaks again?

If a warranted part fails during the warranty period, we'll repair or replace it at no charge. Just call us and we'll schedule a service visit promptly.

Is there a warranty on your labor?

Yes, all labor is warranted for a minimum of 1 year. Spring and installation labor carries a 10-year warranty. If our workmanship causes any issue, we'll fix it at no cost.

What is your satisfaction guarantee?

We guarantee 100% satisfaction. If you're not happy with our work for any reason, let us know within 30 days and we'll make it right. Your satisfaction is our commitment.

Do you warranty garage door openers?

Openers come with manufacturer warranties ranging from 1-5 years depending on the model. We add our 1-year labor warranty. If your opener fails during the warranty period, we handle all warranty service.

How do I file a warranty claim?

Simply call us at (201) 554-6769 and reference your original service. We keep detailed records of all work and will verify your warranty coverage promptly. Most warranty claims are handled within 24-48 hours.

Are garage door tracks and rollers covered under warranty?

Yes, all parts we install including tracks, rollers, hinges, and cables are covered under our warranty. The specific warranty period depends on the part and service provided.

Can I schedule recurring maintenance?

How can I leave a review of your service?

Do you offer commercial contracts for property managers?

Technical & Products

Brands, parts, and technical questions

12 Questions

What type of springs do you install?

We install high-quality torsion and extension springs rated for 25,000+ cycles. We use premium springs that last 3-4 times longer than standard springs. All springs come with our 10-year warranty.

What's the difference between torsion and extension springs?

Torsion springs mount above the door and twist to provide lift. Extension springs run along the tracks and stretch. Torsion springs are safer, quieter, last longer, and are standard on modern garage doors. We can upgrade extension spring doors to torsion systems.

How do I know what size garage door I have?

Measure the width and height of your door opening. Common sizes are 8x7, 9x7, 16x7 (single doors) and 16x7, 18x7 (double doors). Our technicians will verify measurements during the free estimate to ensure proper parts.

What R-value insulation do you recommend?

For Northern NJ winters, we recommend R-value of 12-18 for attached garages. Higher R-values provide better temperature control and energy efficiency. We can explain insulation options during your consultation.

Can I install a heavier door on my existing opener?

It depends on your opener's horsepower rating. We'll assess your opener's capacity and recommend the appropriate upgrade if needed. Most standard openers handle doors up to 200-300 lbs. We can upgrade to belt-drive or jackshaft openers for heavier doors.

What horsepower garage door opener do I need?

1/2 HP is standard for most single and double doors. 3/4 HP is recommended for oversized, heavy, or insulated doors. 1HP+ is for commercial applications. We'll recommend the right power for your specific door.

What safety features should my garage door have?

Modern doors must have photoelectric sensors that reverse the door if anything breaks the beam, auto-reverse if the door hits an object, and manual release for emergency exit. All our installations include required safety features and comply with current safety codes.

Can you install a battery backup on my opener?

Yes! We install battery backup systems that operate your door during power outages. This is essential for keeping your car accessible during storms and emergencies. Available for compatible LiftMaster, Chamberlain, and Genie openers.

What is a jackshaft opener and when would I need one?

A jackshaft (wall-mount) opener mounts beside the door instead of the ceiling. It's ideal for garages with low ceilings, no ceiling space, or vaulted ceilings. It's also quieter and more secure than traditional openers.

Do you install windows in garage doors?

Yes! We can add or replace windows in most garage door panels. Windows come in various styles including clear, frosted, and decorative glass. They add natural light and curb appeal.

What type of rollers do you use?

We install nylon or steel rollers depending on your preference. Nylon rollers are quieter and don't require lubrication. Steel rollers are more durable for high-use applications. We can explain the pros and cons of each.

Can I get a garage door with smart features?

Yes! Modern openers offer WiFi connectivity, smartphone control, delivery access codes, activity monitoring, and integration with smart home systems. We install and configure all major smart opener brands including LiftMaster MyQ and Chamberlain.

installation

Common questions and answers

10 Questions

How long does a garage door installation take?

Most single garage door installations are completed in 4-6 hours. Double doors or customized installations may take a full day. We schedule enough time to ensure quality work and won't rush the job.

Do I need to be home during installation?

We prefer you're home at the start to discuss details and at the end for the walkthrough demonstration. You don't need to stay the entire time if you're comfortable, though many customers do.

Will installation damage my driveway or garage?

No. We take precautions to protect your property including using drop cloths and cleaning up completely. Our professional installers are trained to work cleanly and carefully.

Can you install a garage door in any weather?

We can install in most weather conditions. Extreme cold, heavy rain, or high winds may require rescheduling for safety and proper installation. We'll communicate any weather-related scheduling needs.

Do you remove and dispose of my old garage door?

Yes! We remove your old door, tracks, springs, and opener, and dispose of everything properly. The price includes complete removal and cleanup.

Can I choose any garage door style?

Yes! We offer hundreds of styles, colors, and designs from major manufacturers. We'll help you choose a door that matches your home's architecture and fits your budget.

How soon can you install after I approve the estimate?

Stock doors can often be installed within 3-7 days of approval. Custom or special-order doors may take 2-4 weeks. We'll provide a specific timeline during your consultation.

Do you install garage door decorative hardware?

Yes! We can install decorative hardware, handles, hinges, and accessories to enhance your door's appearance. Carriage house and rustic styles particularly benefit from decorative hardware.

Will my new garage door require maintenance?

Minimal maintenance is needed. We recommend annual professional inspection and lubrication, monthly visual inspection, and keeping tracks clean. We offer maintenance packages to keep your door in top condition.

Do you install custom garage doors?

Yes! We work with manufacturers who create custom doors in any size, style, material, and color. Ideal for unique openings, historic homes, or specific design requirements. Custom orders typically take 4-8 weeks.

Still Have Questions?

Our friendly team is here to help. Get in touch and we'll answer any questions you have about our garage door services.
